comments:
* DTP 0.7 RC0 Build 20060309 on Eclipse 3.2M5a *

1. Connect to Apache Derby 10.1 in the DSE
2. Expand the tree into the "SYSIBM" table
3. Expand the "Stored Procedures" folder
4. Select "SQLPROCEDURES"
5. Right click to get context menu
6. Select "Run..."
7. The following st appears:

eclipse.buildId=I20060223-1656
java.version=1.4.2_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -clean

Error
2006-03-09 11:19:11.36
Editor core plugin internal error

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.datatools.sqltools.routineeditor.ProcEditorInput.<init>(ProcEditorInput.java:44)

Hi Der Ping, sql dev tools depends on modelbase.sql.query, whose MANIFEST.MF misspelled the activator class, which should be org.eclipse.datatools.sqltools.parsers.sql.query.util.SQLQueryParserPlugin insteadof org.eclipse.datatools.sqltools.parsers.sql.query.SQLQueryParserPlugin. Thanks!

The following st is probably more relevant here:

eclipse.buildId=I20060223-1656
java.version=1.4.2_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -clean

Brian and Sheila,

Could you look into this? According to John's update, it looks like it is coming from SQL Query Model.

Thanks,

Der Ping
I've updated MANIFEST.MF in org.eclipse.modelbase.sql.query plugin to point to the correct location.
Nobody has since complained so it appears to be OK now.
